channel.title: This Site Makes Me Want to Cry :(
channel.description: This Site Makes Me Want to Cry :(

item.title: How to Write A One Pager (with Templates and Examples)
item.description:
How to Write A One Pager (with Templates and Examples)

This is an article all about One Pagers. You might be asking: A One Pager is simple one page document that gives a high-level overview of a product, service, or business. They are great for promoting your business location, or giving a synopsis or a product to the person in charge of purchasing.

item.title: How To Write A Blog Post Your Clients Are Dying To Share - Psychology for Photographers and other Creative Professionals
item.description:
How To Write A Blog Post Your Clients Are Dying To Share - Psychology for Photographers and other Creative Professionals

Imagine for a moment that someone is coming over to photograph you. Decide for yourself why they would be coming - are they photographing your family together? Are they doing a profile on you as an up-and-coming entrepreneur for a local magazine? Whatever makes you feel excited.

item.title: Why You're Wasting Your Welcome Email (and What to Do About It)
item.description:
Why You're Wasting Your Welcome Email (and What to Do About It)

Well, you finally did it. You created an email list for your blog. That means you're now converting casual visitors into something far more valuable - subscribers. Feels pretty good, doesn't it? It should. You're building a loyal audience who actively wants to hear from you.

item.title: 6 Simple Exercises to Help You Write Better Short Sentences [Free Worksheet] - Copyblogger
item.description:
6 Simple Exercises to Help You Write Better Short Sentences [Free Worksheet] - Copyblogger

Short sentences are gospel truths when it comes to clear, concise writing. In fact, no lesson about writing for the web is complete without the statement "use short sentences." And who is not going to use short sentences when they were cherished by Papa? Nobody. Because you don't want Hemingway on your bad side.

item.title: How to Create a Valuable Lesson Plan that Sells Your Online Course and Motivates Your Students - Copyblogger
item.description:
How to Create a Valuable Lesson Plan that Sells Your Online Course and Motivates Your Students - Copyblogger

The demand for online education is exploding. The global market for online courses is expected to reach $107 billion in 2015. A mind-boggling figure, right? Imagine stuffing one-dollar bills into a 53-foot truck. Depending on how crumpled your bills are, you'd need around 1,000 trucks stuffed up to the roof to transport those 107-billion dollar bills.

item.title: How to Be a Copywriting Genius: The Brilliantly Sneaky Trick You Must Learn
item.description:
How to Be a Copywriting Genius: The Brilliantly Sneaky Trick You Must Learn

Are your readers doing what you want them to do? Are they registering for your free membership site, downloading your ebook, or signing up for your email newsletter? If not, you need to learn a master craftsman's copywriting secret. This technique acts like a remote control to get your readers to take action.

item.title: SumoMe, free tools to grow your website traffic.
item.description:
SumoMe, free tools to grow your website traffic.

Mar 9th, 2016 by Ashley Hockney Want to hear some grim statistics? Pretty depressing, isn't it? But luckily there's one piece of content out there that subscribers still value and will pay for, and that is an online course. When I Googled "average cost of an online course", the first article from US news reports a student spending upward of $1,000.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide to Font Pairing
item.description:
The Ultimate Guide to Font Pairing

Whether you know it or not, different font combinations create different styles for your designs. To give you a leg up, we've put together 30 unique font pairings to help you determine what font pairing best suits the design or content you're creating.

item.title: The 5 steps to profitiability
item.description:
The 5 steps to profitiability

Facebook Twitter Google+ LinkedIn E-mailProfitability. It's something we all need to strive for as Entrepreneurs. In fact, it's an OBLIGATION to strive for profit. If we don't, we won't be able to continue to provide value to the world, and then EVERYONE loses. There are 5 steps to profitability as an Entrepreneur, and I'll break ...
